subject: Issues with VAM Pro
description_text:
Hello,

I have been using Simsonn pedals and have been very satisfied. I ordered
the VAM Pro motors, and they arrived today. Unfortunately, after mounting
them and plugging them in, I can't get them to work.

I have tried all the steps found on Google (upgrading software, firmware,
grounding the control box, closing SimHub and/or Simsonn Manager, etc.). I
get zero power whatsoever to the motors, even during SimHub testing.

I have tried both USB 3.0 and USB 2.0. Any other things I can try?

Thanks!

*Tim Egorov*
206.349.7996

conversations.body_text: picture of what my Simsonn manager looks like. it will not let me pick VAM Pro

Hi Tim E,    Locate the upgrade button on the PlusX controller and hold it down continuously, then reconnect the USB cable. Once Simsonn Manager shows that it has entered firmware upgrade mode, you can release the button.  Next, follow these steps:    In the software, go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu.    After the update is completed, connect the USB to the USB 3.0 blue port at the back of your PC, then plug in the power cable.    Test the device again to ensure it is functioning properly.

Thank you for your prompt response!

I’m a bit confused by your email. I followed your instructions and
successfully updated the firmware (plusx.sfu). Unfortunately, the pedals
had to be connected to USB in order to access “manual update” and begin the
process.

As such, I was not able to follow steps 2 and 3 exactly how you mentioned
below. I’m not sure if this confusion is why your advice did not help, but
sadly it did not fix the issue. I still see “Power Disconnect” shown like
it was in my original email.

Any other suggestions?

*Tim Egorov*
206.349.7996


On Fri, Sep 12, 2025 at 6:16 PM support@simsonn.com

One more thing: if I try a different USB port at this point in the process,
it not only doesn’t recognize the VAM Pros, but also the pedals themselves.
Not sure if that’s helpful, but figured I’d let you know.

Thanks again,

*Tim Egorov*
